com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory

Class SASocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory.SASocket

  • public abstract class SASocket
extends Object
    This class represents an instance of a Service Connection between a Service Provider and a Service Consumer.

    Developer Guides

    This class represents an active Service Connection between a Service Provider and a Service Consumer. (Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application must declare a subclass of SAAgent). The Service Connection, represented by this class, is the dialogue between the two SAAgent objects.

    The objects of this class are created when a successful Service Connection is established. Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application must declare a subclass of this class, and implement the Service Connection related event handling methods: onReceive(int, byte[]), onError(int, String, int), and onServiceConnectionLost(int).

    Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application can simply call send(int, byte[]) to write on a channel inside the Service Connection. They can also call close() to terminate the Service Connection with the remote Accessory Peer Agent.

    Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application must register a concrete implementation of this class with SAAgent by passing the name and derived concrete class as the parameters of SAAgent constructor. An instance of this class is passed to the SAAgent object in the SAAgent.onServiceConnectionResponse(SAPeerAgent, SASocket, int) callback, once the Service Connection is established with the Accessory Peer Agent. Your application must also implement the public default constructor of this class, as follows: 

     public YourSubclassExtendsThisClass() {
     super("the name of your subclass extends this class");
 }

    The constructor is dynamically referenced by Samsung Accessory package. Your application should never call the constructor.

    When you build your application in release mode, you must add -keep lines in the proguard.cfg file of your application, to prevent ProGuard renaming your subclasses of SASocket and SAAgent. ProGuard is a tool integrated into the Android build system that obfuscates the code by renaming classes and methods. For more information about How to configure ProGuard, please visit the ProGuard page of Android Development Site.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED
      Connection lost because the Accessory Device was detached.
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED
      Service Connection lost because the remote Accessory Peer Agent closed the Service Connection.
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED
      Service Connection lost because it required reliable transfer(retransmission).
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON
      Connection lost for reasons Samsung Accessory Service Framework cannot distinguish.
      static int ERROR_FATAL
      Service Connection lost because of a binding failure with Samsung Accessory Service Framework.

    • Field Detail

      • CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED
        Service Connection lost because the remote Accessory Peer Agent closed the Service Connection. This is a graceful termination initiated by the remote Accessory Peer Agent.

        Constant Value: 513 (0x00000201)

        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        onServiceConnectionLost(int), Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON
        Connection lost for reasons Samsung Accessory Service Framework cannot distinguish.

        Constant Value: 512 (0x00000200)

        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        onServiceConnectionLost(int), Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED
        Connection lost because the Accessory Device was detached.

        Constant Value: 521 (0x00000209)

        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        onServiceConnectionLost(int), Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED
        Service Connection lost because it required reliable transfer(retransmission). Since all retransmission trials failed, Samsung Accessory Service Framework terminated the Service Connection because it cannot meet the reliable transfer requirement.

        Constant Value: 522 (0x0000020A)

        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        onServiceConnectionLost(int), Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_FATAL

        public static final int ERROR_FATAL
        Service Connection lost because of a binding failure with Samsung Accessory Service Framework. This SASocket no longer represents a valid service connection.

        Constant Value: 2048 (0x00000800)

        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        onServiceConnectionLost(int), Constant Field Values

      • SASocket

        protected SASocket(String name)

         super("The name of the subclass that extends SASocket");
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the subclass that extends SASocket.
        Since:
        2.0.19

    • Method Detail

      • onError

        public abstract void onError(int channelId,
           String errorMessage,
           int errorCode)
        Called when an error occurs. Implement error handling mechanisms in this method.
        Parameters:
        channelId - The channel ID.
        errorMessage - The error message.
        errorCode - The error code.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • onReceive

        public abstract void onReceive(int channelId,
             byte[] data)
        Called when data is received from the remote Accessory Peer Agent. Implement this method to handle the received data properly in order to realize the application's use cases.
        Parameters:
        channelId - The ID of the Service Channel on which the data is received.
        data - The byte array of the data received.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • onServiceConnectionLost

        protected abstract void onServiceConnectionLost(int reason)
        Called when the Service Connection with the remote Accessory Peer Agent is lost. Reasons can be various, for example: the Accessory Device goes out of range for the wireless connectivity, the Accessory Peer Agent terminates the Service Connection, or an error caused the termination of the Service Connection.

        Implement the connection loss handling mechanism properly, for example, stop sending data on the Service Channels.

        Note: If you want to restore Service Connection, it is your application's responsibility to call SAAgent.findPeerAgents() to try to re-find the remote Accessory Peer Agent and SAAgent.requestServiceConnection(SAPeerAgent) to make Service Connection request again.

        Parameters:
        reason - The reason why the Service Connection with the Accessory Peer Agent is lost.
        Since:
        2.0.19
        See Also:
        CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED, CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED, CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON, CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED, ERROR_FATAL

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Get the status of the underlying Service Connection.
        Returns:
        true if an active Service Connection exits to a remote SAPeerAgent. false if the Service Connection has been terminated
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • getConnectedPeerAgent

        public SAPeerAgent getConnectedPeerAgent()
        Get the SAPeerAgent object which encapsulates the information of the connected remote Accessory Peer Agent and the Accessory Device that the Accessory Peer Agent runs on. For the Accessory Peer Agent, the information includes, for example, the Service Profile specification version that the Accessory Peer Agent follows and the application name. For the Accessory Device, the information includes, for example, vendor ID, product ID, and device name.
        Returns:
        The SAPeerAgent object which encapsulates the information of the connected remote Accessory Peer Agent.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • send

        public void send(int channelId,
        byte[] data)
          throws IOException
        Send data to a remote Accessory Peer Agent. You must specify on which Service Channel to send data. For example, the Accessory Service Profile Protocol can specify two Service Channels in the Service Connection, one for commands and the other for data.

        Note: This method is a blocking call. If you need to do any heavy lifting or long latency work in this callback, spawn a separate thread. Do not invoke this method on main thread of the application. It processes the byte array completely before returning. Do not send a byte array bigger than SAPeerAgent.getMaxAllowedDataSize().

        Parameters:
        channelId - The ID of the Service Channel for sending data, specified in the Accessory Application Protocol specification and declared in Accessory Service Profile XML file.
        data - The byte array of the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O-related error occurs while sending data.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any argument is invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • secureSend

        public void secureSend(int channelId,
              byte[] data)
                throws IOException
        Send encrypted data to a remote Accessory Peer Agent. You must specify on which Service Channel to send data. For example, the Accessory Service Profile Protocol can specify two Service Channels in the Service Connection, one for commands and the other for data.

        Note: This method is a blocking call. If you need to do any heavy lifting or long latency work in this callback, spawn a separate thread. Do not invoke this method on main thread of the application. It processes the byte array completely before returning. Do not send byte array bigger than SAPeerAgent.getMaxAllowedDataSize().

        Parameters:
        channelId - The ID of the Service Channel for sending data, specified in the Samsung Accessory Application Protocol specification and declared in Accessory Service Profile XML file.
        data - The byte array of the data to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O-related error occurs while sending data.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any argument is invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.19

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the Service Connection with the remote Accessory Peer Agent. You cannot reconnect to this Service Connection later, so a new Service Connection has to be established as needed. The Service Channels configured from the Accessory Service Profile XML during the Service Connection are considered to be closed once the service connection is closed.

        The SASocket is closed, and all Service Channels are lost.

        Since:
        2.0.19
